H0.text: The 19th century invention Paige Compositor sought to replace the typewriter but ended up becoming a failure. Which American author lost nearly all his fortune for its development. Mark Twain

H1.text: The 19th century invention Paige Compositor sought to replace the typewriter but ended up becoming a failure. Which American author lost nearly all his fortune for its development. Edgar Allan Poe

H2.text: The 19th century invention Paige Compositor sought to replace the typewriter but ended up becoming a failure. Which American author lost nearly all his fortune for its development. Herman Melville

H3.text: The 19th century invention Paige Compositor sought to replace the typewriter but ended up becoming a failure. Which American author lost nearly all his fortune for its development. Twainian

A4.text: Twain invested in ventures that lost most of it, such as the Paige Compositor, a mechanical typesetter that failed because of its complexity and imprecision.

A5.text: Twain spent $300,000 (equivalent to $9,774,828 in 2024) on it between 1880 and 1894.
